intro: Verbascum × collinum subsp. killiasii, commonly known as the Killias' mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy yellow or orange flowers in the summer months, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
